title: League running at 111% cpu usage since new client - how?

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Ever since the new client now my game freezes in game.

It's kind of like a lag spike but I noticed that i wasn't dropping frames or network packets... i was consistently at 70-80 fps and 40ms ping during the spike.

So then I thought maybe the cpu can't draw fast enough because if it could during those "lag spikes" 

i should see either 1-10 fps or like 300 ms ping but nope I never have low fps or high ping. 

So I'm guessing the culprit is my CPU? Which suprises me because I think i'm on a decent laptop.


MacBook Air (Mid 2013)
Mac OS El Captian 10.11.4
Processor 1.5GHz Intel Core i5 
4GB RAM 1600 MHZ
Intel HD Graphics 500 1536 MB

I haven't noticed this problem before.... Also sidenote : this even happens when league is the ONLY program running. It feels like League + the new client is a cpu hog and the new client takes up much more mb of ram (about 800-1100mb) than the legacy (about 600 mb).

Can anybody shed light on what it means to be using over 100% cpu?

P.S. These "cpu drops" tend to happen inconveniently of course when a team fight or couple of ultimates erupt.
P.S.S. Yes i'm using the lowest possible settings in the game

replies.body:
Can't help with League of Legends, but I will drop some mad knowledge:

These days pretty much every CPU has 2+ cores (dual core, quad core, etc). Each core *basically* acts like its own CPU. The CPU usage listed in the resource monitor tracks usage across all cores. So if League alone is using say 60% of one core and 65% of another core, you'd end up with a listed CPU usage of 125%.

The updated client is still in testing, and this is a great report to help the client devs with mac testing.  Post this over to the [client discussion ](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion)boards and share your feed back.  Thanks for testing!
